column4: Hey all. Is there any reason why X should be eating up ~600MB of memory?
Probably just general X weirdness, I have never encountered problems with X unless it's either buggy or misconfigured.
Thanks, but this has been happening since Ubuntu 8.*. Seems a bit ridiculous at this point if you know what I mean.
I've even disabled Compiz and proprietary drives just to make sure it's not those messing up the works.
